text: thanks everyone for being here so yeah my name is Luke Obon and today I'm gonna be talking about programming the cloud

fingertips that we can really take advantage of in a really natural way not hand over to some operations team to do

an abstraction becomes really useful then when you build standard libraries out of it you build libraries of these

and what it means as a as a developer trying to target this environment and so
sort of imagine you know one of the environments we have and also to talk about this from a JavaScript perspective and how JavaScript itself has evolved
you know JavaScript started in sort of the web right and that was the execution environment was the page and every time
I navigate from page to page in some sense my entire world gets torn down and restarted up again with some different
set of JavaScript and so everything's very transient in this execution environment right like I sort of have
this these pages are very short-lived things and I sort of load my code in by
a script tags and sort of everything is very stateless everything that I want to be stateful I have to send off to some
you know API server or something like that to sort of manage the state but my application environment itself is this
very short-lived thing that's that sort of has no long-term state associated with it they you know further along in
in JavaScript lifetimes or no J's happened but certainly sort of the thing that probably folks here are most familiar with this sort of a process
model is sort of the server process right the the idea that I have some operating system process and folks often
think about these things as sort of living for a long time right I run my process on my server and it lasts for
days months years potentially but one of the key things about processes that they
do sort of fundamentally have this idea that they have a finite lifetime right now either they you know crash because I
put did something bad in my process and so it died or the machine they're running on crashes and so they're no
longer there or I want to update them I want to run a new piece of code and so the only way for me to run a new piece
of code is to actually you know deploy the new piece of code into a new process tear down the old process and make sure
that anyone who is using it is pointed at the new thing and so process is sort of fundamentally have this No should have a finite lifetime that
they're going to run for you can deliver these through sort of elf binaries or Windows X's or what-have-you and again
still processes are largely stateless because they can die their state is sort of managed somewhere else either in on
disk or in you know some operating system or other concept that's going to maintain the statefulness
and so in the cloud I think there's this this other kind of process and this
thing doesn't really have a name as far as I've never seen some sort of standardized name in the industry for this emplou me we call it a stack but
it's sort of the idea that I'm going to deploy some infrastructure into the cloud I'm going to deploy a sort of a
service function for instance right into the cloud and it's gonna be there forever right when I deploy a service function
it doesn't matter if any given process dies if any given ec2 instance underneath the hood dies that service
function is logically exists forever and has an endpoint that's accessible that's
going to access it and so this notion of sort of a an execution model where the thing I've deployed is a is a process
that's gonna run forever and every time I want to make a change I don't make a change by deploying a new xee or
deploying a new you know JavaScript bundle what I do is I make a change by describing a new desired state and
telling some orchestration tool to drive my environment my existing environment which is still running into that new
state and so this is sort of more like you know for folks who have used things like editing continue this was a big
thing I remember when I sort of started my career was sort of vb6 it had editing continue and in.net we didn't have

that one of the reasons they feel so different is that they're not just a process it's not just I go onto a VM and
I restart the process and I'm all good it really is that this application I'm developing is one that's going to run
effectively forever I need to edit it as it's running and so I think that's that sort of a key a key new idea and
that changes a lot of these things so one other concept I wanted to touch on
really quickly sort of the applications and infrastructure piece right and one of the interesting things that I've
